H0.text: Evaporation is the process in the water cycle directly caused by the heat from the Sun.

H1.text: Runoff is the process in the water cycle that is directly caused by heat from the Sun.

H2.text: Cloud formation is the process in the water cycle that is directly caused by the heat from the Sun.

H3.text: Stream flow is the process in the water cycle that is directly caused by the heat from the Sun.

A4.text: The sun (solar energy) drives evaporation of water from oceans, lakes, moisture in the soil, and other sources of water.

A5.text: The amount of light will affect the evaporation. When photons hit the surface area of the liquid they can make individual molecules break free and disappear into the air without any need for additional heat.

A6.text: The water cycle is powered by the energy emitted from the sun. There are several ways in which this is accomplished, one of the first ways is through evaporation where the energy from the sun heats the water in oceans, lakes, streams, rivers, seas, ponds, etc.

A7.text: The source of energy for evaporation is primarily solar radiation.
